  proposition: Daphne Ippolito, Ann Yuan, Andy Coenen, and Sehmon Burnam studied creative writing with an AI-powered writing assistant.
    entity-attribute relationships:

  proposition: Farhana Shahid, Maximilian Dittgen, Mor Naaman, and Aditya Vashistha examined human-AI collaboration for co-writing constructive comments online.

  proposition: Mathias Peter Verheijden and Mathias Funk explored collaborative diffusion for boosting designerly co-creation with generative AI.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Mathias Peter Verheijden|RESEARCHED|collaborative diffusion
    Mathias Funk|RESEARCHED|collaborative diffusion

    entity-entity relationships:

  proposition: Jeba Rezwana and Mary Lou Maher developed COFI, a framework for modeling interaction in human-AI co-creative systems.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Jeba Rezwana|DEVELOPED|COFI
    Mary Lou Maher|DEVELOPED|COFI
    COFI|TYPE|framework
    COFI|PURPOSE|modeling interaction in human-AI co-creative systems

    entity-entity relationships:
    Jeba Rezwana|COLLABORATED_WITH|Mary Lou Maher

  proposition: Minzhi Li, Taiwei Shi, Caleb Ziems, Min-Yen Kan, Nancy Chen, Zhengyuan Liu, and Diyi Yang investigated co-annotation with uncertainty-guided work allocation between humans and large language models.

  proposition: Zheng Zhang, Zheng Ning, Chenliang Xu, Yapeng Tian, and Toby Jia-Jun Li created PEANUT, a human-AI collaborative tool for annotating audio-visual data.
